result.execSummary:
All charges against Roscoe R Meeks in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Roscoe R Meeks is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roscoe R Meeks

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State of North Carolina no longer want to extradite.  Extraditon is being changed to North Carolina and bordering states.  On State's motion, Court ordered case dismissed.
Case dismissed without prejudice.

Defendant Roscoe R Meeks in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Roscoe R Meeks in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Roscoe R Meeks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of North Carolina.  Defendant waived extradition.  Signed Waiver of Extradition received and filed.  Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/0a25f782-7319-dd31-4ed9-c0f452a2bc2b  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
